title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Reports Higher Profit
text:
By Patrick Thomas

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (TMO) said its profit rose for its third quarter as revenue increased about 6% from a year earlier.

The lab-equipment company reported a profit of $760 million, or $1.88 a share, compared with $709 million, or $1.75 a share, a year ago.

The company reported adjusted earnings of $2.94 a share. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of $2.00 a share, or $2.87 a share on an adjusted basis.

Revenue rose to $6.27 billion from $5.92 billion a year earlier. Analysts had expected $6.18 billion of revenue in the quarter. Revenue in the company's life sciences solutions unit revenue grew 13% to $1.70 billion.

Write to Patrick Thomas at patrick.thomas@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 23, 2019 06:31 ET (10:31 GMT)
